title: Scoreless Days
outcome: In desperation, the Council halts all BCI scoring and controls for two weeks, citing the need for 'system stabilization.' Citizens are suddenly free of algorithmic barriers. At first chaos and confusion erupt, but informal networks of mutual aid and trust emerge. Temporary peace and unity form—yet as the BCI is set to return, deep unresolved fault lines threaten to fracture society anew.

events.description: Council announces a full BCI shutdown for two weeks, promising a brief "reset" and urging citizens to demonstrate civic responsibility without algorithms.
With all algorithmic restrictions lifted, citizens crowd once-restricted spaces. At first chaos erupts, but local leaders and mutual aid groups emerge to mediate disputes.
Street-level trust tokens appear—symbolic badges of reliability used in place of digital scores. Informal systems of access and fairness gain quick popularity.
Rada Miskovic leads an open assembly, asking if citizens wish to restore, reform, or end the BCI. Debates are passionate, with deep divisions exposed.
Two weeks pass. As Council prepares to restore the BCI, the city is split between those who trust new local networks and those who demand a return to centralized control.
